title.narrative: International Air Cargo Interdiction Training II (ILEA)

description.narrative: ILEAs help advance U.S. interests through international cooperation while promoting global social, political and economic stability through combating crime. ILEAs provide high quality training and technical assistance, support institution building, enhance enforcement capabilities and foster positive relationships between American law enforcement agencies and their counterparts in each respective region.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Department of Homeland Security

description.narrative: These on-site advisors provide technical assistance in a variety of areas such as: targeting and risk management, selectivity, duty collection, appraisement, classification, cargo inspection, passenger inspection, high-tech equipment, general management, integrity programs, canine enforcement, smuggling, information collection and analysis, and legal/regulatory considerations.

description.narrative: The objection of this training is to provide an overview of seaport operations and current threats in the host nations seaport environment. Both classroom and field exercises reinforce the topics discussed.
